page.title: 07TEGGS NOSE COUNTRY PARK
page.content: An area of scrubland bought by Cheshire County Council in 1972 kept as a public amenity.Summit is 1265ft above sea level.Area is 135 acres.Park supports 119 plant, 70 bird &19 mammal species.Park divisible into 2 areas,Amenity & Quarry.Amenities include Car Park,Toilets,Snackbar,Information Kiosk,Viewing Point,Picnic area & averages 150000 visitors p.a..A full time warden is employed & others in Summer tourist season.Maintenance and improvements carried out jointly by County Council & Manpower Services Commission.Park is midpoint of Gritstone Trail,a long distance footpath stretching 17 miles North-South from Lyme Park to Rushton Spencer on the Staffordshire border.The Quarry area of the park is dealt with on the next page.
